channel.title: R on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in R on A Hugo website

item.title: AI analytics 1 - Overview of dataset
item.description: Read in data and functions source("2018-02-21-ai-analytics/BDVis.R") ## Loading required package: ggplot2 ## Loading required package: dplyr ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union ## Loading required package: gridExtra ## ## Attaching package: 'gridExtra' ## The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr': ## ## combine CH1.demo<-readRDS("2018-02-21-ai-analytics/CH1.demo.RDS") CH2.demo<-readRDS("2018-02-21-ai-analytics/CH2.demo.RDS") Visualization procedure: Use the column name to quote the column, aggregate the column, see function col.

item.title: Visualization collection
item.description: High dimensional scatterplot, diagnal plots are the require(GGally) ## Loading required package: GGally data(tips, package="reshape") ggpairs(data=tips, # data.frame with variables columns=1:3, # columns to plot, default to all. title="tips data", # title of the plot mapping=ggplot2::aes(colour = sex) #colour = "sex" ) # aesthetics, ggplot2 style ## `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. ## `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. Density plot by category

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
